1614_0.name: Camper
1614_0.description: Complete all of area one and then the final three areas as part of a camping weekend (or longer) with at least 8 people.

1616_0.name: Chef
1616_0.description: Complete area one or area two & three.  Two badges can be awarded if all areas are completed.

6063_0.name: Global Issues
6063_0.description: Complete three activities from the first area, and then the reflection requirement.

22407_0.name: Leadership
22407_0.description: Complete all parts of the first module and one part of the last module.

414_0.name: Mountain Biking
414_0.description: Complete all parts of one section (competition and exhibition, or expedition), post 2015, over a 6-12 month period

1625_0.name: Physical Recreation
1625_0.description: Choose one area and aim to work on the badge for 6-12 months.  Area 1 is equestrian, 2 is martial arts, 3 is master at arms, 4 is angler and 5 is for any other physical recreation activity

426_0.name: Science - Astronomy
426_0.description: Complete this badge over 6-12 months - this is actually just one area of the "Science" badge but it is separated here for clarity.

425_0.name: Science - Electronics
425_0.description: Complete this badge over 6-12 months - this is actually just one area of the "Science" badge but it is separated here for clarity.

423_0.name: Science - Mechanic
423_0.description: Complete this badge over 6-12 months - this is actually just one area of the "Science" badge but it is separated here for clarity.

422_0.name: Science - Meteorology
422_0.description: Complete this badge over 6-12 months - this is actually just one area of the "Science" badge but it is separated here for clarity.

427_0.name: Science - Naturalist
427_0.description: Complete this badge over 6-12 months - this is actually just one area of the "Science" badge but it is separated here for clarity.

424_0.name: Science - Radio
424_0.description: Complete this badge over 6-12 months - this is actually just one area of the "Science" badge but it is separated here for clarity.

6066_0.name: Street Sports
6066_0.description: Complete all parts of this badge

442_0.name: Survival Skills
442_0.description: Complete all parts - the second area should be done as a two night camp

1629_0.name: Water Activities
1629_0.description: Choose one of the four areas

436_0.name: DofE Bronze (Duke of Edinburgh)
436_0.description: A Bronze DofE programme has 4 sections, Volunteering, Physical, Skills and Expedition.  You must do a minimum of 3 months activity for each of the Volunteering, Physical and Skills sections, and plan, train for and do a 2 day (1 night) Expedition.   You also have to spend an extra three months on one of the Volunteering, Physical or Skills sections.  It's your choice which one and, though you can change your mind later, you should decide which section you want to do for longer at the beginning.  Knowing how long you're going to do it for will help you to choose your activity and set your goals for each section.

437_0.name: DofE Silver (Duke of Edinburgh)
437_0.description:
A Silver DofE programme has 4 sections, Volunteering, Physical, Skills and Expedition.  You need to do at least 6 months Volunteering and a minimum of 6 months on either Physical or Skills and 3 months on the other . It's up to you which one you do for longer.
The Expedition section involves planning, training for and doing a 3 day (2 night) expedition.

If you start your Silver without doing Bronze first you'll have to do an extra 6 months volunteering or doing whichever of the Physical or Skills sections you have spent more time on.  Though you can change your mind later, you should decide which section you want to do for longer at the beginning.  Knowing how long you're going to do it for will help you to choose your activity and set your goals for each section.

438_0.name: DofE Gold (Duke of Edinburgh)
438_0.description:
You'll spend 12 months on your Volunteering section.  For Physical and Skills you must spend 12 months on one and six months on the other - you decide which way round you do it.

Your expedition will be for four days and three nights (plus an acclimatisation day) and should take place in 'wild country'.

The big difference at Gold is you'll also do a Residential section - staying away from home for five days and four nights doing a shared activity with people you don't know.  It's great fun and a real chance to do something different!

If you've jumped straight into your Gold DofE programme you'll need to do a further six months either volunteering or whichever one of your physical or skills activities you spent the most time on.

For Gold, you'll need to do your programme for at least 12 months if you've achieved your Silver Award, or 18 months if you've started at Gold level without doing your Silver - even if you've done Bronze.

95_0.name: Hikes
95_0.description:
In the 'Initial Pre-OSM' column, enter the number of hikes before the record was put in OSM. 

Do not expect the Total column to be the addition of everything you see on screen as it includes hikes from previous sections.

Then add a new column for each hike, and enter the number of hikes completed (usually 1).

94_0.name: Nights Away
94_0.description:
In the 'Initial Pre-OSM' column, enter the number of nights away before OSM. 

Do not expect the Total column to be the addition of everything you see on screen as it includes camps from previous sections.

Add a new column for each camp, and enter the number of nights completed.

1635_0.name: Paddle Sports
1635_0.description:
Stage 1 can be awarded if the scout has BCU Paddle Start.  Stage 2 if BCU Paddle Discover Award.  Stage 3 if BCU Paddle Explore Award.  Stage 4 if the scout has 2 BCU Performance Awards (see The Scouts website for further details).

Scouts must complete each stage before moving to the next stage, and stage 3 must be completed in a different boat to stage 2.

1636_0.name: Sailing
1636_0.description: Each stage can automatically be earned if the scout has the equivalent RYA Youth Sailing Scheme Staged award.  Each stage can only be completed when the previous stage has been completed.   Stage 3 should ideally be done in a different boat to Stage 2.

5965_1.name: Snowsports
5965_1.description: Before starting the next stage, the requirements for the previous stage must have been met.

23361_0.name: Swimmer
23361_0.description: Each level can be earned by having equivalent swimming awards from national swimming providers.  See The Scouts' website for more details.

104_0.name: Time on the Water
104_0.description:
In the 'Initial Pre-OSM' column, enter the number of sessions the scout had before the scout's record was put in OSM.  If the scout has been transferred to you then this field will already be set - do not change it.

Do not expect the Total column to be the addition of everything you see on screen as it will also include sessions from previous sections that you cannot see here.

Then add a new column for each event, and enter the number of sessions completed on that event (typically 1).

You can not delete columns, as that needs to exist behind the scenes for the calculations in other sections.

390_0.name: Diamond
390_0.description:
The Chief Scout's Diamond Award is the highest of the Chief Scout's Awards, and the final step before the Queen's Scout Award.
Complete part 1, then either the Duke of Edinburgh award or the four challenges.
All Members should complete six months in either the physical activity or the skill.

398_0.name: Explorer Belt
398_0.description:
The explorer belt is the challenge of a lifetime, open to explorer scouts aged 16 and over and members of the scout network.

It is a chance to take part in a ten-day expedition that brings a real understanding of a different country, its people and way of life.

18432_2.name: King Scout Award
18432_2.description:
Award participants must:
* Be aged between 16 and 25 years old
* Be a member of Explorer Scouts or Scout Network (or both) for at least 18 months
* Be a member of Explorer Scouts or Scout Network at the time you complete the award
* Complete 18 nights away with Scouting, of which 12 must be camping.

(None of these are enforced in OSM)

22416_0.name: King's Scout Award
22416_0.description:
Award participants must:
* Be aged between 16 and 25 years old
* Be a member of Explorer Scouts or Scout Network (or both) for at least 18 months
* Be a member of Explorer Scouts or Scout Network at the time you complete the award
* Complete 24 nights away as an Explorer Scout or Scout Network member, of which 12 must be camping.

(None of these are enforced in OSM)

391_1.name: Platinum
391_1.description: Complete part one, and then either the DoE Bronze or the platinum challenges.  Members must undertake an extra three months in any of the skills, physical recreation or service challenges.

9751_0.name: Scouts of the World
9751_0.description: This is only available to Network members who are over the age of 18.

24764_0.name: Adventure Challenge Award (Challenge Awards)
24764_0.description:
The Adventure Challenge Award is all about having great experiences and seeing new and exciting places. Work as a team to plan out your challenge, thinking about the skills you might need and who can help you learn them

Whether it’s trying out a new adventure sport, organizing an expedition, planning a sponsored event, or mapping out an unfamiliar location, use this Challenge Award to help you get there. 

This is part of the Explorers test and learn process.

24766_0.name: Community Engagement Challenge Award (Challenge Awards)
24766_0.description:
The Community Engagement Challenge Award is all about being an active member of your community and engaging with your fellow citizens. Think about how you can really engage with members of your local community to make it an even better place to be.

Whether it’s fundraising for a local cause, improving areas in your local environment, running classes at a community centre, or putting on a celebration event for local heroes, use this Challenge Award to help you get there. 

Part of the test and learn challenge award.

24763_0.name: Employability Challenge Award (Challenge Awards)
24763_0.description:
The Employability Challenge Award is all about personal growth and professional development. Utilise your Explorer and local professional networks to seek coaching and get you on track for success.

Whether it's gaining more confidence in public speaking, getting ready for your driving theory test, securing a part time job, organising a careers fair, or getting more confident cooking at home, use this Challenge Award to help you get there. 

This badge is part of the Explorers Test and Learn programme.

24767_0.name: International Challenge Award (Challenge Awards)
24767_0.description:
The International Challenge Award is all about being and active member of the international community and engaging with your fellow global citizens. Explore your opportunities and some of the challenges you might face along the way.

Whether it’s completing a project with an international Explorer Unit, visiting another country, raising money or awareness for an international cause, or putting on a community banquet of international foods, use this Challenge Award to help you get there. 

Part of the Explorers test and learn programme.

24765_0.name: Leadership Challenge Awards (Challenge Awards)
24765_0.description:
The Leadership Challenge Award is all about being a great member of a team and knowing when and how to take the lead. Think about the different roles needed within a team, and how everyone can contribute and be at their best.

Whether it’s providing a programme of activities for a younger section, meeting and learning from leaders in your community, or completing projects whilst taking on several different roles within a team, use this Challenge Award to help you get there.

24768_0.name: Values Challenge Award (Challenge Awards)
24768_0.description:
This award is all about discovering what matters to you and how your values shape the way you live, lead, and support others. Work as a team to plan a series of activities that explore the Scout Promise, spiritual reflection, equity, diversity, and inclusion. Think about how your beliefs influence your actions—and how you can help others explore theirs.

Whether it’s leading a reflection, celebrating a significant day, exploring different faiths, or creating inclusive activities, use this Challenge Award to deepen your understanding and make a positive impact.

Part of the Explorers Test and Learn Programme.

2060_0.name: Young Leader Belt (Young Leaders)
2060_0.description: A Young Leader belt buckle should be awarded on completion of the entire scheme (completion of ALL training modules and missions).

2056_0.name: Young Leader Mission 1 (Young Leaders)
2056_0.description: Task – run a variety of games: indoor, outdoor or as part of a camp (minimum of three).

2057_0.name: Young Leader Mission 2 (Young Leaders)
2057_0.description: Task – plan and run an activity (not a game) as part of either the section programme or a camp programme.

2058_0.name: Young Leader Mission 3 (Young Leaders)
2058_0.description: Task – to take the section's programme ideas to a programme planning meeting.

2059_0.name: Young Leader Mission 4 (Young Leaders)
2059_0.description: Task – responsibility for organising and running part of the section programme.

4423_1.name: Zodiac Award - 1 Bronze (Zodiac Award (2017))
4423_1.description:
The purpose of the Zodiac Award is to encourage outdoor nights away experiences including camping, bivouacs, and expeditions in different – and sometimes unusual - environments at different times of the year. 
Complete 6 Nights Away under canvas, bivouac or bothy, The nights away must cover four different seasons – spring, summer, autumn & winter, The nights away must feature 6 of the 30 Zodiac Award Challenges

4434_1.name: Zodiac Award - 2 Silver (Zodiac Award (2017))
4434_1.description:
The purpose of the Zodiac Award is to encourage outdoor nights away experiences including camping, bivouacs, and expeditions in different – and sometimes unusual - environments at different times of the year.  
Hold the Zodiac Bronze Award, Complete 8 additional Nights Away under canvas, bivouac or expedition, The nights away must be in eight unique months. Camps of a longer duration that include more than one month can count, The nights away must feature 8 of the 30 Zodiac Award Challenges (not including those (6) featured in the Bronze Award)

4440_1.name: Zodiac Award - 3 Gold (Zodiac Award (2017))
4440_1.description:
The purpose of the Zodiac Award is to encourage outdoor nights away experiences including camping, bivouacs, and expeditions in different – and sometimes unusual - environments at different times of the year. 
Hold the Zodiac Silver Award, Complete 12 additional Nights Away under canvas, bivouac or expedition, The nights away must be in twelve unique months. Camps of a longer duration that include more than one month can count, The nights away must feature 12 of the 30 Zodiac Award Challenges (not including those (14) featured in the Bronze and Silver Awards)

22413_0.name: Earth Tribe
22413_0.description: Complete all requirements of one module.

443_0.name: Membership
443_0.description: The Membership Award is only completed by young people joining from outside the Movement once they've been invested.

103_0.name: Union Flag
103_0.description: The badge may be worn during overseas trips and indefinitely upon return

102_0.name: Joining In
102_0.description:
The length of time is calculated from the 'Joined movement' date in the Personal Details.

If the value is incorrect, fix the 'Joined Movement' date in the Personal Details area, then come back here and award the level the member has.

582_29.name: Group name tape (Identity)
582_29.description: Generic badge for Group name tapes (if we all list our own, the result will be massive!)

4442_1.name: Pentland District Badge (Identity)
4442_1.description:
Pentland District Badge (worn on the right sleeve below the Scottish Saltire flag and to the left of the regional badge - for more details see link below)

https://members.scouts.org.uk/documents/Scouts/Scouts_Uniform%20Diagrams%20(2017).pdf

466_15.name: Scotland Badge (Identity)
466_15.description:
Scotland Saltire Flag (worn on the right sleeve below the group name tape and above the regional/district badges - for more details see link below)

https://members.scouts.org.uk/documents/Scouts/Scouts_Uniform%20Diagrams%20(2017).pdf

4443_0.name: South East Scotland Region Badge (Identity)
4443_0.description:
South East Scotland Region Badge (worn on the right sleeve below the Scottish Saltire flag and to the right of the district badge - for more details see link below)

https://members.scouts.org.uk/documents/Scouts/Scouts_Uniform%20Diagrams%20(2017).pdf

14982_0.name: Central Badge - YouShape Award (YouShape Award)
14982_0.description: This badge is all about thinking about what you want to achieve, setting a goal and making it happen.

14984_0.name: Lead - YouShape Award (YouShape Award)
14984_0.description: Now it's time to take the lead – think supporting others, delivering your programme and nights away.

14983_0.name: Plan - YouShape Award (YouShape Award)
14983_0.description: This badge is all about thinking creatively, working together and planning some exciting activities for your programme.

14985_0.name: Represent - YouShape Award (YouShape Award)
14985_0.description: Think about how you’ll represent your group – you could engage your community, invite some friends to join the fun or chat to your Executive Committees.
